mainEntity.name: What is the standard transaction tax on DRIP token transfers within the Drip Network?

acceptedAnswer.text: A standard 10% tax is levied on DRIP token transfers to deter excessive trading and support the rewards pool.

mainEntity.name: What is the purpose of the buy tax in the Drip Network?

acceptedAnswer.text: The buy tax, usually set at 10%, is implemented to encourage the purchase of tokens within the network.

mainEntity.name: How does the sell tax impact the Drip Network?

acceptedAnswer.text: A 10% sell tax is applied to curb sell pressure, thereby supporting token stability within the Drip Network.

mainEntity.name: What are dividend and claim taxes, and why are they important?

acceptedAnswer.text: Dividend and claim taxes are applied to earnings claims, encouraging users to reinvest and strengthen the rewards pool.

mainEntity.name: How does the Drip Network tax structure benefit users?

acceptedAnswer.text: The tax structure promotes long-term engagement and deters speculative trading, ensuring ecosystem sustainability and token price stability. Users can optimize their participation by adopting long-term holding strategies and carefully analyzing transaction costs.

mainEntity.name: Where can I find more information about the Drip Network?

acceptedAnswer.text: For more details on the Drip Network, visit the official [Drip Network Community website](https://drip.community/).
